p: The studied plant, Acokanthera schimperi (locally called “merenz”) is widely used for the traditional treatment of wound 9, 10 and various microbial infections such as tonsillitis (leaf), bacterial infection of the nails, leprosy (leaf), tinea capitis (leaf), and sexually transmitted diseases. Additionally, it is used for the treatment of eczema (leaf), swelling (root and leaf), rheumatic pain (stem), elephantiasis (root), common cold (leaf) and headache (root and bark), scabies, warts, and against snake bite as anti-venom. 11, 12
